alert.note: Alert for Coastal Del Norte; Mendocino Coast; Northern Humboldt Coast; Southwestern Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued February 25 at 8:47PM PST until February 26 at 9:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM PST SATURDAY THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Westerly swell around 6 to 9 feet at 20 seconds will bring a substantial risk of sneaker waves to area beaches. * WHERE...Coastal Del Norte, Mendocino Coast, Northern Humboldt Coast and Southwestern Humboldt Counties. * WHEN...From 5 AM PST Saturday through Saturday evening.. . * IMPACTS...Large, unexpected waves can sweep across the beach without warning, sweeping people into the sea from rocks, jetties, and beaches. These waves can also move large objects such as logs, crushing anyone caught underneath.
info.instruction: Don`t be fooled by an ocean that looks calm. there can be 30 minutes of small waves before a sneaker wave strikes. Avoid rocks and jetties. Avoid steep beaches. Stay much farther back from the water and never turn your back on the ocean.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Del Norte; Mendocino Coast; Northern Humboldt Coast; Southwestern Humboldt
